area_name: Wall That Dreams Are Made Of

content.description: Say goodbye to your knuckle-skin! The hardman tick of the state. You gotta drive to NC to find better crack than this! May or may not have anchors added up top; I heard they were installed by a Cville guy a while ago. Tape helps.
Climb the arete to the right of The The.
content.location: locate the bolted line to the right of The The.

content.description: Classic old school trad crack problem. Leftward,  Mini gastons, tips locks, to keepers, short.
content.protection: Small stopper's especially RP's and now maybe small tech cams
content.location: 80 meters ESE of the route "Good Friday" is a very large boulder with a very thin angling crack on the east side.

content.description: Jam up crack which turns into a full body pod, exit on excellent hand jams. Slightly overhanging at exit.
content.location: About 50 to 100 down hill and right from Bushwack Crack is a another crack.

content.description: Decent toprope once you've led the crack. Let's face it, any extra milage after you've made the journey to this area softens the blow of the hike out.
content.location: Just left of Bushwhack Crack, from same anchors.

content.description:
Fun, solid hand crack. Depending on your hand size, the crux could be the bouldery start, the wide funkiness in the middle, or the thin hands at the top. Hexes work great on this route and lighten your load-I used my#3,3.5,and #4 camalots in the first 20 feet and wished I had more cowbell all the way home.

 Here's a first person vid of the route:  ​Bushwhack Crack​​​
content.protection: From #1 camalot up, big hexes, extras in wide sizes handy.
content.location: Head in a southern direction on the Bushwhack Trail.  You'll pass the OMG Dihedral on your left.  If you veer too far left, you'll find yourself on higher ground above The Wall that Dreams Are Made Of.  Stay on the lower ground to the right as you head downhill, keeping the rock to your left, and eventually you'll find it.

climbs.name: Banana Crack
climbs.fa: Greg Collins, George Flam, John Mckigney, 1983

content.description: A fun thrash. I led this one with one #5 camalot and a set of old Chouinard tube chocks. Modern wide gear would be more expensive and shiny, not to mention probably more likely to get kicked out of place as you dolphin past it.
content.protection: Biggest cams you got and jeans with the ankles taped to your socks.
content.location: A little downhill past The The.

pathTokens: Wall That Dreams Are Made Of

content.description: One of the best crags in Virginia. Don't go to Joshua Tree to get on superb granite, just head up to the hills, and bring your bear goggles-90% of the bears I've seen in my life up close were hanging out in this area.
